Report
STUDY: CT Chest with contrast
 
CLINICAL HISTORY:  Chest pain, question PE.
 
FINDINGS:  Multiple contiguous transaxial slices through the chest were
obtained after the intravenous administration of contrast with coronal
oblique 3D MIP images for a pulmonary embolism protocol CT.  This study
was performed with techniques to keep radiation doses as low as
reasonably achievable, (ALARA). Individualized dose reduction techniques
using automated exposure control or adjustment of mA and/or kV according
to the patient size were employed.
 
 
There is normal opacification of the heart and great vessels. 
Specifically, there is no evidence for pulmonary embolism or aortic
dissection. The aorta is calcified and ectatic. The heart is enlarged.
There are calcifications of the coronary arteries. There is bibasilar
dependent atelectasis without infiltrate, suspicious mass or effusion. 
There is no mediastinal adenopathy. There are layering gallstones.
 
IMPRESSION:  No evidence for pulmonary embolism.
Transcriptionist: Self Correct, Radiologist
